intro: Scrophularia lepetymnica, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Figwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, usually blooming in late spring to early summer. It is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. Scrophularia lepetymnica is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is considered a rare or endangered species in some areas.
